About Me

Let me tell you a few things

BIO

My name is Bryce Campbell. I had my first taste of coding in elementary school with the simple drag and drop language Scratch, and I've been coding ever since. I have always loved the challenge of solving new problems, throughout middle and high school I took every chance I could get to learn more, following online tutorials and going to summer camps and classes. Now I am a third-year Computer Science major at Cal Poly and I still love programming, weather it's for a class or a personal project.

PLEXIL Intern

NASA Planning & Scheduling Group - Intelligent Systems Division

As an intern at NASA, I worked on the Plan Execution Interchange Language (PLEXIL) Executive. I worked with experienced mentors to design and implement new features in the language. I improved learning resources and made quality of life additions to the compilation script. My largest project, however, was writing an overhaul to the command and lookup handling infrastructure in PLEXIL. I shifted work from the programmer to the executive by moving command and lookup handling from the old chained conditional approach to a new method of registering handlers into a hash table. After this change, it has become easy and efficient to add commands and lookups to an autonomous system in PLEXIL.

Computer Science Major

California Polytechnic State University

With courses in:

  • Software Engineering
  • Deep Learning
  • Algorithms
  • Discrete Structures
  • Technical Writing
  • Systems Programming

And more!

LIDAR Data Analyst

Continental Mapping Consultants, Inc.

As a Lidar Data Analyst at Continental Mapping Consultants, Inc. I worked hard to surpass expectations and beat my deadlines. I provided thousands of miles of processed LIDAR data at excellent quality.
